availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elzathan Smith (Lyon County, Ky, carpenter and grocer)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, carpenter and grocer. Allen County, Kentucky, native. Married to Arisba M. Smith. Father of William T. Smith, Caroline M. Smith, Frances M. Smith, Samuel H. Smith, Mary F. Smith, and Bishop Smith. Carpenter in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Grocer in Eddyville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 329B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 761.
"Elzathan Smith (1817-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #32487392, accessed December 6, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32487392.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Lyon County Administrators Bonds,vol. 1-2, 1854-1890, p. 301.
